metadata.paragraph_text_preview: This is a case about sanctuary city policies in Illinois. On January 25, 2025, Organized Communities...

target:
This is a case about sanctuary city policies in Illinois. On January 25, 2025, Organized Communities Against Deportation, Brighton Park Neighborhood Council, Illinois Coalition for Immigrant and Refugee Rights, and Raise the Floor Alliance filed this lawsuit in the United States District Court for the Northern District of Illinois, Eastern Division. These plaintiffs are Chicago-based organizations that provide support to immigrant communities and are leaders in the national Sanctuary City Movement. They brought this action against the Acting Secretary of the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS), Acting Director of Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), and ICE under the First Amendment of the U.S. Constitution, 28 U.S.C. § 2201 (Declaration of Rights), and 5 U.S.C. § 706(2)(A), (B) (The Administrative Procedure Act). Plaintiffs sought a declaration that the federal actions here, including plans for ICE to raid Chicago and “squash the Sanctuary City Movement,” constituted a violation of Plaintiffs’ First Amendment rights, an injunction permanently enjoining Defendants from threatening and/or executing Chicago-based immigration raids, and an order setting aside the Defendant’s policy to conduct immigration raids in Chicago for the purpose of targeting and ultimately destroying the Sanctuary City Movement.

On that same day, Plaintiffs also filed a Motion for a Preliminary Injunction and Temporary Restraining Order to enjoin Defendants from threatening and/or executing Chicago-based immigration raids, claiming that they and the communities they represented would be irreparably harmed. Honorable Edmond E. Chang served as emergency judge before the case was assigned to the Honorable John F. Kness and the Honorable M. David Weisman as magistrate judge.

In an amended complaint, filed on January 26, 2025, Plaintiffs added the President of the U.S., new Secretary of DHS, Acting Deputy Attorney General, Border Czar, DHS, and the Department of Justice (DOJ) as Defendants in the lawsuit.

However, on January 29, 2025, Plaintiffs filed a request for leave to withdraw pending motions for a temporary restraining order and preliminary injunction on the basis that the status quo had changed because Defendants had launched ongoing Chicago-based immigration enforcement raids on January 26, 2025. This motion was granted by Judge Kness on January 29, 2025.

On February 26, 2025, Plaintiffs filed a notice of Voluntary Dismissal, citing the above mentioned change in circumstances. The next day, on February 27, 2025, Judge Kness dismissed the case without prejudice.

On January 25, 2025, Organized Communities Against Deportation, Brighton Park Neighborhood Council, Illinois Coalition for Immigrant and Refugee Rights, and Raise the Floor Alliance filed this lawsuit in the United States District Court for the Northern District of Illinois, Eastern Division. These plaintiffs are Chicago-based organizations that provide support to immigrant communities and are leaders in the national Sanctuary City Movement. They brought this action against the Acting Secretary of the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS), Acting Director of Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), and ICE under the First Amendment of the U.S. Constitution, 28 U.S.C. § 2201 (Declaration of Rights), and 5 U.S.C. § 706(2)(A), (B) (The Administrative Procedure Act). Plaintiffs sought a declaration that the federal actions here, including plans for ICE to raid Chicago and “squash the Sanctuary City Movement,” constituted a violation of Plaintiffs’ First Amendment rights, an injunction permanently enjoining Defendants from threatening and/or executing Chicago-based immigration raids, and an order setting aside the Defendant’s policy to conduct immigration raids in Chicago for the purpose of targeting and ultimately destroying the Sanctuary City Movement.

annotation.explanation: Declaratory judgment: declaration that federal actions, including plans for ICE to raid Chicago and “squash the Sanctuary City Movement,” violated Plaintiffs’ First Amendment rights.
Permanent injunction enjoining Defendants from threatening and/or executing Chicago-based immigration raids.
Order setting aside Defendants’ policy to conduct immigration raids in Chicago aimed at targeting and destroying the Sanctuary City Movement.
Plaintiffs: Individual, described as Chicago-based organizations that provide support to immigrant communities and are leaders in the national Sanctuary City Movement.
Plaintiff: Organized Communities Against Deportation (Chicago-based organization that provides support to immigrant communities; leader in the national Sanctuary City Movement)
Plaintiff: Brighton Park Neighborhood Council (Chicago-based organization that provides support to immigrant communities; leader in the national Sanctuary City Movement)
Plaintiff: Illinois Coalition for Immigrant and Refugee Rights (Chicago-based organization that provides support to immigrant communities; leader in the national Sanctuary City Movement)
Plaintiff: Raise the Floor Alliance (Chicago-based organization that provides support to immigrant communities; leader in the national Sanctuary City Movement)
Defendant: Acting Secretary of the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS)
Defendant: Acting Director of Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)
Defendant: ICE
Defendant: DHS (U.S. Department of Homeland Security)

The case centers on sanctuary city policies in Illinois and alleged federal plans to raid Chicago to suppress the Sanctuary City Movement, followed by ICE’s launch of ongoing Chicago-based immigration enforcement raids on January 26, 2025.

Plaintiffs are four Chicago-based immigrant support organizations and Sanctuary City Movement leaders who filed suit on January 25, 2025, in the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of Illinois, Eastern Division.
Initial defendants were the Acting Secretary of DHS, the Acting Director of ICE, and ICE.
Claims were brought under the First Amendment, the Declaratory Judgment Act (28 U.S.C. § 2201), and the APA (5 U.S.C. § 706(2)(A), (B)).

Relief sought included a declaration of First Amendment violations, a permanent injunction against Chicago-based immigration raids, and vacatur of the policy to conduct raids aimed at destroying the Sanctuary City Movement.
Complaint filed on January 25, 2025 (N.D. Ill., Eastern Division), asserting First Amendment, Declaratory Judgment Act, and APA claims and seeking declaratory and permanent injunctive relief.
Case initiated on January 25, 2025 in the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of Illinois, Eastern Division.

annotation.explanation: January 29, 2025: Motion for leave to withdraw pending motions for a temporary restraining order and preliminary injunction granted by Judge Kness.
After ICE launched raids on January 26, 2025, plaintiffs moved on January 29 to withdraw their TRO/PI motions due to the changed status quo; Judge Kness granted the withdrawal the same day.
Request for leave to withdraw pending TRO and PI motions filed on January 29, 2025 (granted the same day).
On January 29, 2025, plaintiffs moved to withdraw the pending TRO/PI motions due to changed circumstances (raids commenced Jan 26); Judge Kness granted the withdrawal the same day.
January 29, 2025: Judge John F. Kness granted plaintiffs' request to withdraw their pending motions for a temporary restraining order and preliminary injunction.
